arm_group.description: Patients with metastatic colorectal cancer scheduled for metastatic surgery
Patients with metastatic colorectal cancer scheduled for general anesthesia without metastatic surgery

brief_summary.textblock:
Observational, non randomized study aimed at measuring the effect of surgical resection of
      metastasis in the urinary concentrations of physiological modified nucleosides in 45
      patients with metastatic colorectal cancer.

study_pop.textblock:
Patients with metastatic colorectal cancer treated at the Department of Medical Oncology
        of Paul Brousse Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Molecularly Imprinted Polymer Sensors of Modified Nucleosides for Non-invasive Monitoring, of Cancer Therapy: Impact of Surgical Resection of Metastasis on Urinary Excretion of Modified Nucleosides.

oversight_info.authority: France: Afssaps - Agence française de sécurité sanitaire des produits de santé (Saint-Denis)

primary_outcome.description: 1 Urine sample per day 3 before and 7 after surgery Measurement of modified nucleoside concentration
primary_outcome.measure: Effect of resection of metastasis on urinary excretion of modified nucleosides

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Measurement of modified nucleosides in urine samples before and after metastatic resection
secondary_outcome.measure: Identification of modified nucleosides as biomarkers for colorectal cancer

clinical_study.source: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

lead_sponsor.agency: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
